metadata.description: Enhanced security checks configuration with multi-framework support

security_checks.name: Lambda Function Resource Policies
security_checks.description: Ensure Lambda functions have restrictive resource policies
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Lambda function resource policies do not allow public or overly permissive access. Resource policies control who can invoke functions from outside the account. Overly permissive policies can lead to unauthorized function execution and potential data exposure.

security_checks.name: EKS Cluster Public Access
security_checks.description: Ensure EKS clusters do not have public API endpoints
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon EKS clusters are not configured with public API endpoints unless explicitly required. Public endpoints expose the Kubernetes API to the internet, increasing the attack surface. Private endpoints ensure that cluster management traffic stays within the VPC.

security_checks.name: Redshift Cluster Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure Redshift clusters are encrypted at rest
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Redshift clusters have encryption enabled for data at rest. Encryption protects sensitive data stored in data warehouses from unauthorized access. This is critical for clusters containing business intelligence data, PII, or other sensitive information.

security_checks.name: ALB Access Logging
security_checks.description: Ensure Application Load Balancers have access logging enabled
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Application Load Balancers (ALBs) have access logging enabled. Access logs provide detailed information about requests sent to the load balancer, which is essential for security analysis, troubleshooting, and compliance auditing.

security_checks.name: ECR Image Scanning
security_checks.description: Ensure ECR repositories have image scanning enabled
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon ECR repositories have image scanning enabled to detect vulnerabilities in container images. Scanning on push ensures that vulnerabilities are identified before deployment, reducing the risk of deploying vulnerable containers to production.

security_checks.name: SQS Queue Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure SQS queues are encrypted at rest
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon SQS queues have server-side encryption (SSE) enabled. Encryption protects message data at rest and helps meet compliance requirements for data protection. This is especially important for queues processing sensitive or regulated data.

security_checks.name: SNS Topic Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure SNS topics are encrypted at rest
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon SNS topics have encryption enabled for data at rest. SNS encryption ensures that messages are protected while stored in the service. This is critical for topics that handle sensitive notifications or integrate with compliance-regulated systems.

security_checks.name: IAM Policy Least Privilege Analysis
security_checks.description: Analyze IAM policies for overly permissive permissions
security_checks.detailed_description: This check analyzes IAM policies to identify overly permissive permissions such as wildcard actions (*) or resources. Following the principle of least privilege reduces the risk of unauthorized access and limits the potential impact of compromised credentials.

security_checks.name: CloudFormation Stack Drift Detection
security_checks.description: Ensure CloudFormation stacks are monitored for drift
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that CloudFormation stacks have drift detection enabled and are regularly checked for configuration drift. Drift detection helps identify unauthorized changes to infrastructure that could introduce security vulnerabilities or compliance violations.

security_checks.name: Aurora Database Activity Streams
security_checks.description: Ensure Aurora clusters have database activity streams enabled
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Aurora clusters have database activity streams enabled for real-time auditing. Activity streams provide a near real-time stream of database activity for compliance, security analysis, and troubleshooting without impacting database performance.

security_checks.name: ECS Task Definition Security
security_checks.description: Ensure ECS task definitions follow security best practices
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that ECS task definitions follow security best practices including: not running as privileged, not using host network mode, using read-only root filesystems where possible, and not storing secrets in environment variables.

security_checks.name: Athena Workgroup Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure Athena workgroups enforce encryption for query results
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Athena workgroups are configured to enforce encryption for query results. Encrypting query results protects sensitive data that may be exposed through analytical queries and ensures compliance with data protection requirements.

security_checks.name: Glue Data Catalog Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure AWS Glue Data Catalog is encrypted
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that AWS Glue Data Catalog has encryption enabled for metadata. The Data Catalog contains metadata about data sources, which could reveal sensitive information about data structure and content if exposed.

security_checks.name: Step Functions Logging
security_checks.description: Ensure Step Functions state machines have logging enabled
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that AWS Step Functions state machines have logging enabled to CloudWatch Logs. Logging provides visibility into workflow execution, helps with debugging, and enables security monitoring of automated processes.

security_checks.name: EventBridge Rule Security
security_checks.description: Ensure EventBridge rules have appropriate targets and permissions
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that EventBridge rules are configured with appropriate targets and do not have overly permissive permissions. Misconfigured rules could lead to unauthorized event routing or exposure of sensitive event data.

security_checks.name: Kinesis Stream Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure Kinesis data streams are encrypted
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Kinesis data streams have server-side encryption enabled. Encryption protects streaming data at rest and is essential for streams processing sensitive or regulated data such as financial transactions or personal information.

security_checks.name: MSK Cluster Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure Amazon MSK clusters have encryption in transit and at rest
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (MSK) clusters have both encryption in transit and at rest enabled. This ensures that sensitive data flowing through Kafka is protected from unauthorized access.

security_checks.name: AppSync API Authentication
security_checks.description: Ensure AppSync APIs have appropriate authentication configured
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that AWS AppSync GraphQL APIs have appropriate authentication mechanisms configured (API Key, AWS IAM, Cognito User Pools, or OIDC). APIs without proper authentication are vulnerable to unauthorized access and data exposure.

security_checks.name: DocumentDB Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure DocumentDB clusters are encrypted at rest
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon DocumentDB clusters have encryption at rest enabled. DocumentDB often stores document-oriented data that may contain sensitive information, making encryption essential for data protection.

security_checks.name: Neptune Database Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure Neptune graph databases are encrypted at rest
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Neptune graph databases have encryption at rest enabled. Graph databases often contain relationship data that could reveal sensitive patterns or connections, making encryption critical for protecting this information.

security_checks.name: IAM Root Access Key Deletion
security_checks.description: Ensure no root account access keys exist
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that the AWS root account does not have any access keys. Root access keys provide unrestricted access to all resources in the AWS account. Using root access keys violates the principle of least privilege and significantly increases security risk.

security_checks.name: IAM Password Policy Uppercase
security_checks.description: Ensure IAM password policy requires uppercase letters
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that the IAM password policy requires at least one uppercase letter. Strong password policies that include character complexity requirements help prevent brute force attacks and improve overall account security.

security_checks.name: Hardware MFA for Root
security_checks.description: Ensure hardware MFA is enabled for root account
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that hardware MFA (not virtual MFA) is enabled for the root account. Hardware MFA devices provide stronger protection against phishing and other attacks compared to virtual MFA, making them essential for protecting the most privileged account.

security_checks.name: S3 Bucket Versioning
security_checks.description: Ensure S3 buckets have versioning enabled
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that S3 bucket versioning is enabled. Versioning helps protect against accidental deletion and provides the ability to recover from both unintended user actions and application failures. It's essential for data recovery and compliance requirements.

security_checks.name: S3 Bucket MFA Delete
security_checks.description: Ensure S3 buckets have MFA delete enabled
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that S3 buckets with versioning enabled also have MFA Delete configured. MFA Delete adds an extra layer of security by requiring multi-factor authentication to permanently delete object versions or change versioning state, protecting against accidental or malicious deletions.

security_checks.name: EBS Default Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure EBS default encryption is enabled
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that EBS default encryption is enabled at the account level. When enabled, all new EBS volumes are automatically encrypted, ensuring data at rest protection without requiring developers to remember to enable encryption for each volume.

security_checks.name: CloudTrail S3 Bucket Logging
security_checks.description: Ensure S3 bucket access logging is enabled on CloudTrail S3 bucket
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that the S3 bucket storing CloudTrail logs has access logging enabled. This provides detailed records about requests made to the CloudTrail bucket, enabling detection of unauthorized access attempts to audit logs.

security_checks.name: KMS Key Rotation
security_checks.description: Ensure rotation for customer-created KMS keys is enabled
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that automatic key rotation is enabled for customer-managed KMS keys. Key rotation helps limit the amount of data encrypted under a single key version and reduces the impact of key compromise.

security_checks.name: VPC Flow Logs for All VPCs
security_checks.description: Ensure VPC flow logging is enabled in all VPCs
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that VPC Flow Logs are enabled for all VPCs. Flow logs capture information about IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in VPCs, essential for security analysis, compliance, and troubleshooting.

security_checks.name: Security Group SSH Restriction
security_checks.description: Ensure no security groups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that security groups do not allow unrestricted SSH access from the internet. Open SSH access significantly increases the attack surface and risk of unauthorized access. SSH should be restricted to known IP ranges or accessed via bastion hosts.

security_checks.name: Account Manipulation Detection
security_checks.description: Monitor for unauthorized IAM policy changes
security_checks.detailed_description: This check monitors CloudTrail for unauthorized IAM policy modifications that could indicate account manipulation attempts. It looks for policy changes outside of approved change windows or by unauthorized users, which could indicate privilege escalation attempts.

security_checks.name: Create Account Detection
security_checks.description: Alert on new IAM user/role creation
security_checks.detailed_description: This check monitors for creation of new IAM users or roles, which could indicate unauthorized access attempts. It verifies that CloudWatch alarms are configured to alert on CreateUser, CreateRole, and CreateAccessKey API calls.

security_checks.name: Network Sniffing Prevention
security_checks.description: Ensure encryption for all data in transit
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that all data in transit is encrypted using TLS 1.2 or higher. It examines load balancers, API gateways, and other services that handle data transmission to ensure they enforce encryption, preventing network sniffing attacks.

security_checks.name: Data Destruction Protection
security_checks.description: Implement immutable backups
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that critical data is protected with immutable backups using AWS Backup vault lock or S3 Object Lock. This prevents ransomware and insider threats from destroying backups, ensuring data can be recovered even after destructive attacks.

security_checks.name: DoS Protection
security_checks.description: Enable AWS Shield and rate limiting
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that AWS Shield is enabled and appropriate rate limiting is configured on APIs and applications. It ensures protection against DDoS attacks and implements throttling to prevent resource exhaustion.

security_checks.name: Segregation of Production
security_checks.description: Ensure production accounts are separated
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that production workloads are isolated in separate AWS accounts from development and testing environments. Account separation provides strong security boundaries and prevents accidental or intentional cross-environment access.

security_checks.name: Cross-Account Role Trust
security_checks.description: Review cross-account role trust policies
security_checks.detailed_description: This check reviews IAM roles that allow cross-account access to ensure trust relationships are appropriate and follow least privilege. It identifies overly permissive trust policies that could allow unauthorized account access.

security_checks.name: Data Classification Tags
security_checks.description: Ensure resources are tagged with data classification
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that all resources handling sensitive data are properly tagged with data classification levels. Proper tagging enables automated security controls and helps ensure appropriate protection based on data sensitivity.

security_checks.name: Service Quotas Monitoring
security_checks.description: Monitor service quota utilization
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that CloudWatch alarms are configured to monitor service quota utilization. This prevents service disruptions due to hitting quotas and helps identify potential resource exhaustion attacks.

security_checks.name: Auto Scaling Configuration
security_checks.description: Ensure auto scaling is properly configured
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that auto scaling groups are configured with appropriate scaling policies, health checks, and termination policies. Proper auto scaling ensures availability and helps defend against resource exhaustion attacks.

security_checks.name: API Gateway Authentication
security_checks.description: Ensure all API Gateways require authentication
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that all API Gateway endpoints have authentication enabled using IAM, Cognito, or API keys. Unauthenticated APIs are vulnerable to abuse and can lead to data exposure or resource exhaustion.

security_checks.name: Container Image Signing
security_checks.description: Ensure container images are signed and verified
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that container images in ECR are signed and that ECS/EKS are configured to only run signed images. Image signing prevents running tampered or malicious container images in production.

security_checks.name: Secrets in Code
security_checks.description: Scan for hardcoded secrets in Lambda functions
security_checks.detailed_description: This check scans Lambda function code and environment variables for hardcoded secrets, API keys, and passwords. Hardcoded secrets are a major security risk and should be stored in AWS Secrets Manager or Parameter Store.

security_checks.name: CORS Configuration
security_checks.description: Validate CORS policies on S3 and APIs
security_checks.detailed_description: This check validates Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) configurations on S3 buckets and API Gateways to ensure they don't allow overly permissive access. Misconfigured CORS can lead to data theft via malicious websites.

security_checks.name: Input Validation
security_checks.description: Ensure WAF rules validate inputs
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Web Application Firewall (WAF) is configured with rules to validate and sanitize inputs, protecting against injection attacks. It checks for OWASP Core Rule Set or equivalent custom rules.

security_checks.name: Network Micro-segmentation
security_checks.description: Implement micro-segmentation with Security Groups
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that security groups implement proper micro-segmentation following zero trust principles. It ensures that security groups are specific to application tiers and don't allow broad internal access.

security_checks.name: Continuous Identity Verification
security_checks.description: Continuous verification of user identities
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that systems implement continuous identity verification through session monitoring, behavioral analytics, and re-authentication for sensitive operations. This is a key zero trust principle.

security_checks.name: Device Trust Verification
security_checks.description: Verify device compliance before access
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that device trust is validated before granting access to resources. It ensures that only managed, compliant devices can access sensitive resources, implementing zero trust device security.

security_checks.name: Data Encryption Everywhere
security_checks.description: Encrypt data at all stages
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that data is encrypted at rest, in transit, and in use across all services. It implements zero trust data security by ensuring encryption is applied consistently without exceptions.

security_checks.name: Time-bound Privileged Access
security_checks.description: Time-bound privileged access
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that privileged access is time-bound and automatically expires. It ensures that administrative permissions are granted only for the duration needed, implementing just-in-time access principles.

security_checks.name: Application Security Metrics
security_checks.description: Track application security metrics
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that application security metrics are being collected and monitored, including vulnerability counts, patch compliance, and security testing results. These metrics are essential for security posture management.

security_checks.name: Data Retention Policies
security_checks.description: Enforce data retention policies
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that data retention policies are implemented and enforced across S3, CloudWatch Logs, and databases. It ensures compliance with regulatory requirements and prevents indefinite data storage.

security_checks.name: Configuration Change Detection
security_checks.description: Detect unauthorized configuration changes
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that AWS Config is enabled with rules to detect unauthorized configuration changes. It ensures that any deviations from approved configurations are quickly identified and can be remediated.

security_checks.name: Production Data in Non-Production
security_checks.description: Prevent production data in test environments
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that production data is not present in development or test environments. It looks for data classification tags and cross-account access patterns to identify potential data leakage.

security_checks.name: Key Management Lifecycle
security_checks.description: Implement key management lifecycle
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that cryptographic keys follow a complete lifecycle including generation, distribution, storage, rotation, and destruction. It ensures compliance with key management best practices.

security_checks.name: Hardware Asset Inventory
security_checks.description: Maintain inventory of all AWS resources
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that a complete inventory of all AWS resources is maintained using AWS Config, Systems Manager, or tagging. Asset inventory is fundamental for security management and incident response.

security_checks.name: Software Asset Inventory
security_checks.description: Track all software and AMIs in use
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that all software components, AMIs, and container images are tracked and inventoried. It ensures that unauthorized or vulnerable software can be quickly identified and removed.

security_checks.name: Configuration Enforcement
security_checks.description: Enforce secure configurations via SCPs
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Service Control Policies (SCPs) are used to enforce secure configurations across the organization. SCPs provide preventive controls that cannot be overridden at the account level.

security_checks.name: Centralized Log Collection
security_checks.description: Centralized log collection
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that all logs are centrally collected in a dedicated logging account or S3 bucket. Centralized logging is essential for security monitoring, incident response, and compliance.

security_checks.name: Continuous Network Monitoring
security_checks.description: Continuous network monitoring
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that continuous network monitoring is implemented using VPC Flow Logs, Network Firewall logs, and CloudWatch metrics. It ensures that network anomalies and attacks can be quickly detected.

security_checks.name: Multi-Region KMS Keys
security_checks.description: Ensure KMS keys are replicated across regions
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that critical KMS keys are configured as multi-region keys for disaster recovery. Multi-region keys ensure that encrypted data remains accessible even if a region becomes unavailable.

security_checks.name: Database Activity Monitoring
security_checks.description: Enable database activity monitoring on all RDS instances
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that database activity streams or enhanced monitoring is enabled on all RDS instances. Database activity monitoring is crucial for detecting unauthorized access and meeting compliance requirements.

security_checks.name: API Gateway Request Validation
security_checks.description: Enable request validation on API Gateway
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that API Gateway has request validation enabled to validate request parameters and body. Request validation helps prevent malformed requests and potential injection attacks.

security_checks.name: ElastiCache Encryption in Transit
security_checks.description: Ensure ElastiCache uses encryption in transit
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that ElastiCache clusters have encryption in transit enabled. This protects cached data from network sniffing attacks and ensures secure communication between clients and cache nodes.

security_checks.name: Backup Vault Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure all AWS Backup vaults are encrypted
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that AWS Backup vaults use encryption for stored backups. Encrypted backups protect sensitive data even if backup storage is compromised.

security_checks.name: Service Control Policies
security_checks.description: Implement preventive SCPs in Organizations
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Service Control Policies are implemented to prevent high-risk actions across the organization. SCPs provide defense in depth by enforcing security invariants that cannot be overridden.

security_checks.name: Network Load Balancer TLS
security_checks.description: Ensure NLBs use TLS 1.2 minimum
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Network Load Balancers are configured to use TLS 1.2 or higher for encrypted listeners. Older TLS versions have known vulnerabilities and should not be used.

security_checks.name: IAM Access Analyzer
security_checks.description: Enable IAM Access Analyzer for all regions
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that IAM Access Analyzer is enabled in all regions to identify resources shared with external entities. Access Analyzer helps prevent unintended access by continuously analyzing resource policies.

security_checks.name: EKS Private Endpoints
security_checks.description: Ensure EKS clusters use private endpoints only
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that EKS clusters are configured with private endpoints only, preventing direct internet access to the Kubernetes API. This reduces the attack surface and enforces access through private networks.

security_checks.name: Macie for S3 Scanning
security_checks.description: Enable Macie for sensitive data discovery
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Macie is enabled and configured to scan S3 buckets for sensitive data. Macie helps identify and protect sensitive data like PII, PHI, and financial information.

security_checks.name: SSM Session Manager Logging
security_checks.description: Log all SSM session activities
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Systems Manager Session Manager is configured to log all session activities to S3 or CloudWatch. Session logging provides an audit trail of administrative actions.

security_checks.name: Certificate Manager Expiry
security_checks.description: Monitor certificate expiration in ACM
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that CloudWatch alarms are configured to alert on certificate expiration in AWS Certificate Manager. Expired certificates can cause service outages and security vulnerabilities.

security_checks.name: Transit Gateway Route Security
security_checks.description: Review Transit Gateway route tables
security_checks.detailed_description: This check reviews Transit Gateway route tables to ensure routes follow least privilege principles and don't create unintended connectivity between security zones.

security_checks.name: CodeBuild Environment Variables
security_checks.description: Ensure no secrets in CodeBuild environment
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that CodeBuild projects don't contain secrets in environment variables. Secrets should be stored in Secrets Manager or Parameter Store and referenced dynamically.

security_checks.name: Glacier Vault Lock
security_checks.description: Enable Glacier vault lock for compliance
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Glacier vaults containing compliance data have vault lock policies enabled. Vault lock provides immutable retention policies required for regulatory compliance.

security_checks.name: CloudFront Field Level Encryption
security_checks.description: Enable field-level encryption on CloudFront
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that CloudFront distributions handling sensitive data have field-level encryption configured. This provides an additional layer of encryption for specific sensitive fields.

security_checks.name: WorkSpaces Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure WorkSpaces volumes are encrypted
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon WorkSpaces have encrypted volumes for both root and user volumes. Encryption protects data on virtual desktops from unauthorized access.

security_checks.name: API Gateway Cache Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure API Gateway cache is encrypted
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that API Gateway caching is configured with encryption. Encrypted cache prevents exposure of sensitive cached responses if the cache storage is compromised.

security_checks.name: Lake Formation Security
security_checks.description: Enable Lake Formation security features
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that AWS Lake Formation is configured with fine-grained access controls and data filtering. Lake Formation provides centralized data lake security management.

security_checks.name: EMR Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure EMR clusters use encryption
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that EMR clusters have encryption enabled for data at rest and in transit. EMR processes large amounts of potentially sensitive data that must be protected.

security_checks.name: SageMaker Notebook Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure SageMaker notebooks are encrypted
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that SageMaker notebook instances have encryption enabled for the storage volume. Notebooks often contain sensitive data and model code that must be protected.

security_checks.name: Direct Connect MACsec
security_checks.description: Ensure Direct Connect uses MACsec encryption
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Direct Connect connections use MACsec encryption for layer 2 network security. MACsec provides hop-by-hop encryption for dedicated network connections.

security_checks.name: Control Tower Guardrails
security_checks.description: Enable all mandatory Control Tower guardrails
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that all mandatory and strongly recommended Control Tower guardrails are enabled. Guardrails provide preventive and detective controls for multi-account environments.

security_checks.name: Cost Anomaly Detection
security_checks.description: Enable Cost Anomaly Detection
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that AWS Cost Anomaly Detection is enabled to identify unusual spending patterns that could indicate compromised resources or crypto mining attacks.

security_checks.name: Resource Access Manager
security_checks.description: Review RAM resource shares
security_checks.detailed_description: This check reviews Resource Access Manager shares to ensure resources are only shared with authorized accounts and organizations. Improper sharing can lead to data exposure.

security_checks.name: Batch Job Security
security_checks.description: Secure AWS Batch job queues
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that AWS Batch job queues and compute environments are configured securely with appropriate IAM roles and network isolation.

security_checks.name: Amplify Security Headers
security_checks.description: Enable security headers on Amplify apps
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amplify applications have security headers configured including Content-Security-Policy, X-Frame-Options, and other OWASP recommended headers.

security_checks.name: Timestream Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure Timestream databases are encrypted
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Timestream databases have encryption enabled. Timestream stores time-series data that may contain sensitive operational or IoT metrics.

security_checks.name: IoT Core Policies
security_checks.description: Review IoT Core thing policies
security_checks.detailed_description: This check reviews IoT Core thing policies to ensure they follow least privilege principles and don't allow overly broad permissions that could compromise IoT devices.

security_checks.name: FSx Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure FSx file systems are encrypted
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that all FSx file systems (Windows File Server, Lustre, NetApp ONTAP, OpenZFS) have encryption at rest enabled.

security_checks.name: DataSync Task Logging
security_checks.description: Enable logging for DataSync tasks
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that AWS DataSync tasks have CloudWatch logging enabled to track data transfer activities and identify potential security issues.

security_checks.name: MediaStore Container Policies
security_checks.description: Review MediaStore container policies
security_checks.detailed_description: This check reviews MediaStore container policies to ensure they don't allow public access and follow least privilege principles for media content delivery.

security_checks.name: Comprehend Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure Comprehend uses encryption
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Comprehend jobs and endpoints use encryption for data processing. Comprehend processes potentially sensitive text data that must be protected.

security_checks.name: Personalize Dataset Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure Personalize datasets are encrypted
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Personalize datasets are encrypted. Personalize processes user behavior and preference data that is often sensitive.

security_checks.name: Forecast Dataset Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure Forecast datasets are encrypted
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Forecast datasets are encrypted. Forecast processes business metrics and predictions that may be commercially sensitive.

security_checks.name: Kendra Index Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure Kendra indexes are encrypted
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Kendra search indexes are encrypted. Kendra indexes often contain sensitive enterprise documents and must be protected.

security_checks.name: Lex Bot Security
security_checks.description: Secure Lex bot configurations
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Lex bots are configured with appropriate security settings including encryption, logging, and input validation to prevent injection attacks.

security_checks.name: Polly Data Privacy
security_checks.description: Ensure Polly requests are logged
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Polly synthesis requests are logged for audit purposes. Polly may process sensitive text that should be tracked for compliance.

security_checks.name: Textract Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure Textract uses encryption
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Textract document analysis jobs use encryption. Textract processes documents that may contain sensitive information.

security_checks.name: Translate Encryption
security_checks.description: Ensure Translate uses encryption
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that Amazon Translate jobs use encryption for text translation. Translate may process sensitive business documents requiring protection.

security_checks.name: Backup Plan Testing
security_checks.description: Ensure backup plans are tested regularly
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that AWS Backup plans include regular restore testing to ensure backups are viable. Untested backups may fail when needed most.

security_checks.name: Disaster Recovery Testing
security_checks.description: Regular DR testing and validation
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that disaster recovery procedures are regularly tested and documented. This includes checking for DR runbooks and evidence of recent DR exercises.

security_checks.name: Multi-Account EventBridge
security_checks.description: Secure cross-account EventBridge rules
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that EventBridge rules allowing cross-account access are properly secured and follow least privilege principles.

security_checks.name: PrivateLink Endpoints
security_checks.description: Use PrivateLink for service access
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that PrivateLink endpoints are used for accessing AWS services instead of public endpoints, reducing exposure to the internet.

security_checks.name: CloudHSM Cluster Backup
security_checks.description: Ensure CloudHSM clusters are backed up
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that CloudHSM clusters have regular backups configured. HSM backups are critical for key recovery and business continuity.

security_checks.name: Outposts Security
security_checks.description: Secure AWS Outposts configurations
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that AWS Outposts are configured with appropriate security controls including network isolation and access restrictions.

security_checks.name: Local Zones Security
security_checks.description: Secure Local Zone deployments
security_checks.detailed_description: This check verifies that resources deployed in AWS Local Zones have appropriate security controls considering the different shared responsibility model.

security_checks.name: Wavelength Security
security_checks.description: Secure Wavelength Zone deployments
